This paper is organized by four sections. The proof of our main result, Theorem 2.1, is given in Section 2. The essential idea is to consider the log-convex function instead of the convex function in Theorem 1.3. As applications, in Section 3, we show some characterizations of the chaotic order. Further results based on the Mond-PeÄariÄ‡ method are given in Section 4.

3. Applications to chaotic order


In this section, we show some inequalities on chaotic order (i.e., logâ¡Aâ‰¤logâ¡Bğ´ğµ\log A\leq\log B for A,B>0ğ´ğµ0A,B>0). To achieve our next results, we need the following lemma. Its proof is standard but we provide a proof for the sake of completeness.

Lemma 3.1.

Let A,Bâˆˆğ”¹â€‹(â„‹)ğ´ğµğ”¹â„‹A,B\in\mathbb{B}\left(\mathcal{H}\right) be two strictly positive operators. Then the following statements are equivalent:

  • (i)

    logâ¡Aâ‰¤logâ¡Bğ´ğµ\log A\leq\log B.

  • (ii)

    Brâ‰¤(Br2â€‹Apâ€‹Br2)rp+rsuperscriptğµğ‘Ÿsuperscriptsuperscriptğµğ‘Ÿ2superscriptğ´ğ‘superscriptğµğ‘Ÿ2ğ‘Ÿğ‘ğ‘ŸB^{r}\leq\left(B^{\frac{r}{2}}A^{p}B^{\frac{r}{2}}\right)^{\frac{r}{p+r}}â€ƒfor pâ‰¤0ğ‘0p\leq 0 and râ‰¤0ğ‘Ÿ0r\leq 0.

Proof.

From the well-known â€œchaotic Furuta inequalityâ€ (see, e.g., [2, 3, 6]) the order logâ¡Aâ‰¥logâ¡Bğ´ğµ\log A\geq\log B is equivalent to the inequality (Br2â€‹Apâ€‹Br2)pp+râ‰¥Brsuperscriptsuperscriptğµğ‘Ÿ2superscriptğ´ğ‘superscriptğµğ‘Ÿ2ğ‘ğ‘ğ‘Ÿsuperscriptğµğ‘Ÿ\left(B^{\frac{r}{2}}A^{p}B^{\frac{r}{2}}\right)^{\frac{p}{p+r}}\geq B^{r} for p,râ‰¥0ğ‘ğ‘Ÿ0p,r\geq 0 and A,B>0ğ´ğµ0A,B>0. It is worth mentioning that, Theorem 4.1 is stronger than what appears in [13, Theorem 2.2].

Proof.

On account of (4.6) the inequalities in (4.10) are equivalent to (4.8). From Corollary 4.2 (ii) we have
